channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Inside the $8m Wildbase Recovery centre for birds
item.description: While Covid-19 slowed the country to a standstill, one rehab centre continued to be as busy as ever.

item.title: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 5 June
item.description: A plan for resuming trans-Tasman travel has been sent to the New Zealand and Australian governments. Follow RNZ's blog for the latest.

item.title: Armed Response Teams trial: 'Bizarre' holes in callout data
item.description: Police in the Armed Response Teams failed to record their callouts properly on almost every occasion during the trial's first two months.

item.title: Police investigate stabbing at Auckland carpark
item.description: Police are searching for a person who stabbed a man in a central Auckland carpark.

item.title: Homecoming for some New Zealanders as others stuck in India plead for approval
item.description: About 200 New Zealanders stranded in India since the outbreak of the Covid-19 pandemic finally return home today.

item.title: Trans-Tasman bubble plan from expert group given to prime ministers
item.description: The head of Auckland Airport says it should be possible for flights to Australia to resume state by state.

item.title: Air quality monitoring hits top gear in Central Otago town
item.description: Air quality sensors have been set up every 100 metres in Arrowtown, in what is believed to be the world's densest air monitoring network.

item.title: Sister of Hāwera man who died in custody: 'The police wouldn't talk to us'
item.description: The family of a man who died in custody at the Hāwera police station last year say they were stone-walled by police when they tried to find out what happened to him.

item.title: Napier Council takes the plunge with risky sewage pipe repair
item.description: Napier City councillors have decided to repair a wastewater pipe leaking into the ocean, even though it could cause further damage.

item.title: Fiordland re-directs focus to domestic market
item.description: Fiordland's regional tourism organisation is repositioning itself to attract more New Zealanders to visit.

item.title: Man arrested for smuggling 75,000 cigarettes
item.description: A man has been arrested for smuggling 75,000 cigarettes and another has been sentenced for Customs' largest-ever tobacco fraud case.

item.title: Queenstown unemployment from 1.1% to 18.5% in a year - Infometrics
item.description: Employment in the region is expected to fall 25.2 percent, with lower-wage earners bearing the brunt, but the mayor argues the council is already working to curb that.

item.title: Hospital security guard stabbing: Union demands investigation
item.description: E Tū union is calling for a serious harm investigation after two security guards were stabbed with a pair of scissors at Auckland's Middlemore Hospital.

item.title: Queenstown welfare hub sessions booked out in hours
item.description: With a second wave of redundancies expected in the coming weeks, there are high hopes the centre can help ease the stress for many across the district.

item.title: Wellington Omāroro Reservoir project: council approves $10m boost
item.description: Wellington City Council has approved a nearly $10 million increase to the budget for the building of the Omāroro Reservoir.

item.title: Wrongful 'redundancy' benefit rejections affects 8.9% of applicants - MSD
item.description: Based on the review it is absolutely impossible for MSD to suggest there are no systemic issues, a benefit law specialist with Community Law says.

item.title: Covid-19 tourism $400m recovery funding welcomed by industry
item.description: A South Island regional tourism organisation welcomes a government funding boost, but says it's unlikely to help it return to previous staff numbers.

item.title: Police investigating 'unexplained' death of young child
item.description: An investigation has been launched into the unexplained death of a young child in Palmerston North.
